entry.title: Re: BW/4 Inplace Conversion - Precheck warning - Query wi...
entry.content:
Hi Axel,
I agree to Eduard. We recommend to adjust the queries beforehand: Either delete them as they are obsolete (fastest approach) or correct them before B4H mode. Expectation is that all objects are working properly when the system is technically converted to BW/4HANA: For that reason, many BEx variables that were integrated for the first time in SAP BW/4HANA are have been delivered with SAP BW as well. This allows you to adjust your queries beforehand.
KR Frank

entry.title: Re: API for retrieving GL account master data
entry.content:
Hello @yahaha 

Thank you for your question. You are not limited to using the API API_GLACCOUNTINCHARTOFACCOUNTS_SRV to access G/L account master data. There are other supported options available in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud SAP Help-APIs for General Ledger Accounting. SAP Help-APIs for General Ledger Accounting

You can use Fiori App Export

In the app Manage G/L Account Master Data, you can filter accounts and use the Export to Spreadsheet function. SAP Help ‚Äì Manage G/L Account Master Data

You may also want to synchronise the G/L Account Master Data App to ensure system alignment between tenants. It also helps maintain Quality and Production consistency and checks availability across systems. SAP Help ‚Äì Synchronise G/L Account Master Data

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: BTP-App to Speed up ALM Operations
entry.content:
Challenges in the Systemoverview for Operation

If you do a monitoring of your Systems on a daily basis, it takes it time to get to the relevant information from CALM.

For our operations team in daily business‚Äîand for customers who carry out monitoring independently‚Äîtwo problems arise: 

Firstly, to get an overview of the system status, at least 3‚Äì4 use cases such as ‚ÄúException Monitoring,‚Äù ‚ÄúReal User Monitoring,‚Äù and ‚ÄúHealth Monitoring‚Äù must be analysed. This is a time factor for the support team to start various UIs and analyse the data. Having many environments for various customers, it is crucial that employees do not lose track of which systems are critical and production-relevant. 

Secondly, the information about which system belongs to which environment (Prod, QA and Dev) is missing. This information is not directly visible on the tiles displayed in SAP CALM. Grouping systems by environment and freely assigning system names‚Äîwhich would improve clarity‚Äîcannot be configured. This means that an additional documentation of the respective system landscape is still required. 

Our Solution

Based on the Cloud ALM API, we have developed a BTP application , which addresses these challenges and enriches the solution with additional features such as AI support. 

When you start using this App, you initially have to load once the systems from Landscape Management via the CALM API into a configuration dashboard. Here, the following information can be added to the systems: 

  • Assigning a system to a environment (may be differen from the given role) 
  • Giving a meaningful name 
  • Activate for display the system in the dashboard

This configuration is stored persistently in a database. 

Configuration screen

The main page of the BTP app consists of one tile per system environment. Here, the results for the configured use cases of the systems are displayed. 

If a maintenance window is scheduled for a system in this environment within the next 7 days, it will also be shown. 

Through the integration of an AI solution, it is possible to derive recommended actions by comparing the current status of the use cases with a previous point in time. 

As an additional piece of information, the number of open alerts is also displayed. 

Main Dashborad

On the detail page of a system environment, the detailed figures for the use cases of each configured system are displayed. 
If further investigation of the alerts is required, users can directly jump into the respective system from this view.

Detail Page

Outlook 

Further goals for future implementation phases include, for example: 

  • Integration of systems that are not yet connectable out-of-the-box to SAP CALM, such as SAP Commerce Cloud 
  • Monitoring of third-party systems via an API 

The API is intended not only to check availability, but also to verify whether the retrieved results match the given inputs. 

Conclusion

With this solution, the operations team should be able to quickly and reliably gain an overview of the customer‚Äôs system status. The BTP App enables operations teams to quickly access system health, track maintenance schedules, and respond to alerts efficiently. 

Please add you Ideas or ask questions
Regards
Ingo Schr√∂der
Sybit GmbH, NTT DATA Business Solutions

entry.title: SAC Story Filters: Profit Center & Product ‚Äì Dependent Access Query
entry.content:
Hi All,

We have two public dimensions Profit Center and Product added both as a story filter and enabled Data Access Control for the Profit Center dimension, giving access based on their Business Area say (A, B, C, D, E) and user access is set so they only see profit centers linked to their Business Area.

Current behavior:
Users see only the profit centers they‚Äôre permitted to access. However, our goal is for users to select a profit center and then have the Product filter dynamically show only the products associated with that profit center rather than displaying all products.

for example, suppose a user in Business Area 'B' sees only ‚ÄúDucati‚Äù as their profit center. When they choose Ducati, the Product filter should then only offer options like ‚ÄúPanigale V4‚Äù and ‚ÄúMonster,‚Äù which are explicitly linked to Ducati, instead of showing products linked to other profit centers.

So, to achieve should we enable Data Access Control for the Product dimension as well, so users see only products related to their assigned profit centers? Or is there a more efficient way to implement linked filters using standard SAC functionality, without relying on JavaScript?

Thanks.

entry.title: MDK App Crash on Low Version Android Devices ‚Äì API Level 35 Build
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We‚Äôve encountered an issue where the MDK app built with Android API level 35 is crashing on devices running lower Android versions. The crash seems to occur during app launch or initial interaction and is likely due to compatibility constraints introduced in the newer API level.

Key Observations:

  • Crash reported on devices running Android 8, 9, 10 and 11.
  • App built and deployed using MDK with target API 35.
  • No issues observed on Android 12 and above.

If anyone has faced this issue or found a workaround, please share your insights. Your input would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Joule Based SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant
entry.content:
Introduction

Migrating legacy SAP HANA applications can be a complex and time-consuming process. The Joule-based SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant is a new extension for SAP Business Application Studio that streamlines this journey by leveraging generative AI to automate key migration tasks. This tool is designed to help developers and organizations transition from older architectures like XS Classic and XS Advanced to the modern, cloud-native SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) on SAP HANA Cloud.

Motivation:

Moving away from legacy HANA applications isn't just a technical exercise; it's a strategic move. By migrating to a CAP-based architecture on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), you can:

  • Boost Innovation and Agility: CAP‚Äôs modular framework allows you to develop new features and services faster, responding to market demands with unprecedented speed.

  • Reduce Total Cost of Ownership (TCO): Cloud-native architectures are often more cost-effective to operate and maintain, allowing you to reallocate resources to innovation.

  • Future-Proof Your Applications: Aligning with SAP's strategic "clean core" vision ensures your applications remain relevant, scalable, and ready to leverage future SAP innovations.

  • Enhance Scalability and Resiliency: SAP HANA Cloud and the BTP offer a robust, secure, and highly available environment for your critical business applications.

Value for End Users

The primary value of this assistant for end users is the significant reduction in manual effort and migration time. By automating the conversion of database and service layer artifacts, the tool allows developers to focus on higher-value tasks, such as validating business logic and refining the migrated application. This acceleration empowers businesses to modernize their applications faster, reduce technical debt, and more quickly realize the benefits of a cloud-native architecture.

Architectural Shift

The assistant facilitates a fundamental architectural shift from a monolithic, on-premise application structure to a modular, cloud-based one. The migration targets the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), which provides a robust framework for building enterprise applications on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP). This new architecture promotes a clean core strategy, where custom logic is developed as side-by-side extensions, ensuring that the core SAP system remains standard and easy to upgrade.

Time and Knowledge Required

While the assistant automates a large part of the conversion, it's important to set proper expectations. The tool is a powerful accelerator, but human intervention is still required post-migration to validate, refine, and productionize the application logic. The generated code includes comments that link back to the original source, making it easier for developers to verify that the key business logic has been accurately transformed. Users should have a foundational understanding of the target architecture (SAP CAP) and the source system (XS Classic or XS Advanced) to effectively use the assistant and complete the migration.

AI Value for the Service Layer:

The standout feature of this assistant is its use of generative AI for migrating the service layer. The assistant analyzes legacy artifacts such as .xsodata, .xsjslib, and .xsjs files. It then uses GenAI capabilities in SAP Build Code to generate corresponding CAP service definitions (service.cds, service.js) and custom handler implementations. This AI-powered conversion is particularly valuable because it accelerates the migration of service logic while preserving the original structure and functional behavior where possible.

How to Get Started:

To get started, developers need to have an SAP Business Application Studio dev space with the SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant extension installed. The migration process generally involves these steps:

  1. Set up the necessary connections to the source database using the SAP Cloud Connector.

  2. Open the Migration Assistant Wizard from the Command Palette in SAP Business Application Studio.

  3. Select the migration path (e.g., XSC to CAP or XSA to CAP).

  4. Specify the source project and the target directory for the new CAP application.

  5. Choose to convert the service layer using the GenAI capabilities.

For detailed, step-by-step guides, you can refer to the following documentation:

  • SAP-samples/xsc-cap-migration 

A Deeper Look: What the Assistant Actually Does

The true power of the migration assistant is best seen in the code itself. While the legacy code (XS Classic/Advanced) was tightly coupled to the HANA database, the modern CAP model separates concerns, making the application easier to read, maintain, and scale.

Before: The Legacy Service Layer

This example shows a typical .xsodata file used to expose a service in the legacy XS Classic/Advanced world. It's a declarative way to create an OData endpoint directly from a database view or table.

After: The CAP Service Layer

This is the equivalent CAP service, generated by the assistant. It uses .cds for the service definition, which provides a richer, more powerful data modeling language, and a separate JavaScript file (.js) for any custom logic, promoting a cleaner separation of concerns.

For an even deeper dive into the tool's inner workings and a guided walkthrough, a great resource is the official SAP Community blog bykesavan_s : Joule based SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant - Transforming with Gen AI

Post-Migration Steps: Your Role in the Final Phase

The migration assistant provides a powerful head start, but the journey to a production-ready application requires crucial post-migration steps. Think of this phase as the final seal of quality where you ensure everything is robust and aligned with your business needs.

The migration assistant doesn't just convert code; it provides a comprehensive Migration Report to guide your next steps. This report is your single source of truth, detailing the overall migration status and specific results for each converted artifact. Most importantly, it includes a clear list of post-migration steps tailored for both the database and service layers, giving you a structured roadmap to finalize your application.

 

The Outlook - What's Next for the Migration Assistant: 

The introduction of the Joule-based SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant is a significant step, and there are more enhancements on the horizon. The future outlook for this tool points towards an even more refined and flexible migration experience.

Planned enhancements scheduled before Q3 2025 include:

  • HANA Native Object Migration to HANA Cloud: This new feature will streamline the process of migrating core HANA native database objects directly to SAP HANA Cloud, ensuring a more direct and efficient transition of your data assets.
  • Staged Migration for XSC to CAP: This will enable a more controlled, incremental approach to migrating your XS Classic applications. Instead of a "big bang" conversion, you'll be able to migrate your application in phases, allowing for easier testing, validation, and a lower-risk transition.

These planned features show a clear roadmap focused on providing developers with greater control, flexibility, and efficiency in their modernization journey.

Conclusion:

The Joule-based SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant is a powerful tool that makes moving your legacy apps to the cloud much easier. By automating the tricky parts with AI, it frees you up to focus on what matters most: building great applications. This tool is a key part of SAP's vision for a modern, side-by-side development future, and it's ready to help you get there.

entry.title: $count not returned anymore in OData calls to analytical models in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Until last week, our OData calls to analytical models in SAP Datasphere returned the $count value when using $count=true. Since this week, the requests still work but no longer return any count value.

Has anyone else noticed this change? Do you know if something changed recently in Datasphere OData services regarding $count support or if we need to adapt our queries?

Thanks!

entry.title: Re: moving/rolling sum for specific amount of dates in SAC
entry.content:
@ChrisVC 

I am not sure if this will work with Datasphere source. But in SAC stories there is Business Calculation formula called SMA.

SMA([<measure>],[d/<date dimension>], "<time granularity>", <period>)

7_SMA = SMA([Quantity],[d/Date],"Month",7)  - This is sum of last 7 periods / 7

Now if you just multiply this back by period it will give you the Sum over that period.

7_SUM = SMA([Quantity],[d/Date],"Month",7) * 7

Refer to the help docs here.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/3b7c99a7a7cd4a29bb1c5132d91af341.html#business-functions

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: When using xco libraries I obtain the error message "PUT operation failed"
entry.content:
When developing a helper class to solve a customer problem I used the xco libraries to generate several packages.  

The creation of the packages initially failed and in the try catch block I only received the error message 

"PUT operation failed"

TRY.
        DATA(lo_specification) = put_operation->add_object( i_package_name )->create_form_specification( ).
        lo_specification->set_short_description( short_description ).
        lo_specification->properties->set_super_package( i_super_package_name )->set_software_component( co_dmo_sap_package ).
        DATA(lo_result) = put_operation->execute( ).
        " handle findings
        DATA(lo_findings) = lo_result->findings.
        findings = lo_findings->get( ).
      CATCH cx_root  INTO DATA(generation_exception).
        exception_text = generation_exception->get_text(  ).
ENDTRY.

 So how I am able to find out the root cause?

entry.title: Re: When using xco libraries I obtain the error message "...
entry.content:
The solution is to catch not cx_root but the exception cx_xco_gen_put_exception as described in the online help

 

CATCH cx_xco_gen_put_exception INTO DATA(generation_exception).
exception_text = generation_exception->get_text( ).
findings = generation_exception->findings->get( ).
messages = generation_exception->if_xco_news~get_messages( ).
ENDTRY.

https://help.sap.com/docs/btp/sap-business-technology-platform/generation-error-handling

entry.title: SAP CDC API login with SAML federation (Azure AD)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am integrating my application with SAP Customer Data Cloud (CDC) using the APIs.
We have configured a SAML federation with EntraID (AzureAD), where:

  • Azure AD is the Identity Provider (IdP),

  • SAP CDC is the Service Provider (SP).

My question is:
Which SAP CDC API should I call from my backend / application in order to perform the login and obtain the user session in this scenario?

Has anyone had direct experience or can clarify which is the correct API to use for login with this setup?

Thanks!

entry.title: Re: Maintain/Update Multilingual Texts in Equipment/Funct...
entry.content:
Hello @AbhijitGoswami 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at App Extensibility: Change Technical Object for more details.

To summarise, currently you cannot use the Create/Change Technical Object app in the public cloud to maintain multilingual descriptions directly in the UI.

However, you have two options to achieve that goal:

First is to switch you Logon language in Fiori and update the description in each language. The system stores each text version separately.

Secondly, use the Migration Cockpit in update mode for mass updates or use the released API_TECHNICALOBJECT_SRV to upload multilingual texts.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: How to leverage the SAP AI Core Service to use some powerful AI tools like Claude Code, Chat Wise
entry.content:
Our company is rolling out GitHub Copilot on a large scale. However, in real-world scenarios, a single coding assistant is rarely enough. Different agents shine in different use cases.

For example, in my own experience, Claude Code is far more powerful than GitHub Copilot when it comes to actual coding. It enables true Vibe Coding in a way Copilot simply can‚Äôt.

That said, compliance is always a priority at work. Even if you‚Äôve purchased personal subscriptions, you can‚Äôt just use external models freely. This article will walk you through how to leverage company-provided AI models and integrate them into external AI tools.

 

Prerequisites

First, you‚Äôll need to request an AI Core client ID and secret. One way is via the official request process, but you can also subscribe and deploy it yourself on BTP.

Apply url:

https://wiki.one.int.sap/wiki/display/IECOE/GAI02.08+Service+Now+User+Guideline#GAI02.08ServiceNowUserGuideline-HowtoRequestAPIaccessforSAPGenAIPlatform%28Playground%29 (see Appendix).

Once approved, you‚Äôll receive credentials like this:

{
  "AICORE_AUTH_URL": "https://sapit-core-playground-vole.authentication.eu10.hana.ondemand.com",
  "AICORE_CLIENT_ID": "id",
  "AICORE_CLIENT_SECRET": "secret",
  "AICORE_RESOURCE_GROUP": "1768f3f7-6c5b-45de-aeb8-xxxxxxx",
  "AICORE_BASE_URL": "https://api.ai.prod.eu-central-1.aws.ml.hana.ondemand.com/v2"
}

Our company supports nearly all mainstream models (GPT, Gemini, Sonet, etc.). The challenge is that SAP applies its own unique protocol layer, which makes these endpoints unusable directly with external tools.

To solve this, we need a proxy service that unwraps the SAP protocol and re-exposes it in OpenAI or Anthropic-compatible formats.

Thanks to Arch (EAS) and Xeric Wei, we already have such a proxy available: genaiproxy. It currently supports OpenAI and Anthropic. You can use it as is or fork it to extend for other protocols.

Setup

  • Python version: 3.13.6

  • Create config.json and key.json under config/ (see samples in repo).

  • Run proxy_service_v2.py to start the proxy.

By default, it runs at: http://127.0.0.1:9988

 

Example: Chatwise

Configure Chatwise with the following:

  • Anthropic

    • Base URL: http://127.0.0.1:9988/anthropic

    • API Key: your configured key (e.g. sk-kris)

  • OpenAI

    • Base URL: http://127.0.0.1:9988/openai/v1

    • API Key: your configured key

‚ö†Ô∏èNote: SAP Core AI doesn‚Äôt yet support the response API format. GPT-5 still works, but only through a workaround.

Also, since SAP truncates model suffixes, you might want to hardcode the model name in your tool configuration.

Once set up, Chatwise works seamlessly ‚Äî and the speed is excellent.

 

Example: Claude Code

Claude Code is widely regarded as one of the strongest agents for coding. Unlike GUI-based tools, it‚Äôs CLI-native, so it doesn‚Äôt require setting up an MCP server. It can do even more.

Installation is simple: Claude Code Docs.

To connect it with the proxy, configure your environment variables:

export ANTHROPIC_BASE_URL=http://127.0.0.1:9988/anthropic
export ANTHROPIC_AUTH_TOKEN=sk-kris

That‚Äôs it. Enjoy the full power of Claude Code with your company‚Äôs AI Core.

 

Other tools like Cline work in a similar way.

With this setup, you can stay compliant, use company-provided AI Core services, and still enjoy the full ecosystem of modern AI coding agents.

entry.title: Dunning per Mail/Printing only if there is no Mail-Adress
entry.content:
Hello,

we want to dunn our customers and send the dunning per mail. Only if there is no mail-address in the BP master data, we want the dunning note to be printed. How do we have to define the output control settings?

I already checked the Output-Parameter information and it works, that dunning notes are being sent per mail. But we want the system to send it only if there is a mail adress in the BP master data. Otherwise the dunning note should be printed.

If i choose the settings in the determination step channel like this:

Output TypeRoleAccount TypeDefault Email AddressChannelExclusive Indicator
=DUNN_NOTICE  is not initialEMAILX
=DUNN_NOTICE   PRINT 

SAP creates only an E-Mail when there is a mail address in the BP master Data, which is correct. But if there is no mail address, no mail AND no print is created.

When i choose the settings like this:

Output TypeRoleAccount TypeDefault Email AddressChannelExclusive Indicator
=DUNN_NOTICE  is not initialEMAIL-
=DUNN_NOTICE   PRINT 

SAP prints ONLY when there is no mail address (which is good). But when there is a mail address, SAP prints AND sends a mail.

Can you tell me where i made a mistake? Is the column "Default E-Mail Address" the correct one? Or do i handle the column "Exclusive Indicator" wrongly?

entry.title: Re: Migrative data for PO upload
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

 

Migrate your Data application allows to migrate the initial set of data that is required to start business operations. This data includes:

  • Master data such as customer master data, supplier master data, and so on.

  • Open transactional data. This includes open items, open sales and purchase orders, as well as other open transactions.

  • Balances such as material inventory balances, bank account balances, G/L account balances, and so on. You can also migrate historical account balances.

Open documents need to be processed in the source system before the migration. Freeze periods for changes or double maintenance might be required for some master data objects during the cutover period. For example, partially delivered sales orders must be closed in the source system. Partially open purchase orders must either be closed or cancelled in the source system.

But as per your question to migrate closed PO,

Historical data cannot be migrated. Historical data (transactional data that has been created in the past and relates to long-running or closed processes) cannot be migrated.

Please refer to the below help document for your reference,

What Data Can Be Migrated? | SAP Help Portal

 

Thanks and Regards,
SAP Support.

entry.title: Challenge with sensitive data in SAP SuccessFactors Story Reports
entry.content:
We're facing a challenge when trying to visualize gender distribution in SAP SuccessFactors Story Reports.

Since gender is classified as sensitive data, the system requires a context field, such as Person ID, to access it. However:

  • Without Person ID ‚Üí no data is shown
  • With Person ID as a dimension ‚Üí report becomes unreadable, as it lists all individual Person ID

Our goal is to display gender percentages in a clean bar chart (e.g. headcount by gender or gender distribution over time).

Has anyone found a clean workaround or best practice for this scenario, ideally without using a custom field that replicates gender?

Any insights or tips would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Help Needed with Accrual Rule for India ‚Äì Probation Period Handling
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community, 

I need support with an accrual rule for India, where the probation period end date should be considered in the accrual logic.

Business scenario:

  • During the probation period, employees do not receive any Privilege Leave.

  • After the end of probation, employees are entitled to 1.25 days of Privilege Leave per month.

  • The confirmation of probation can occur on any day within the month.

Example:
An employee joins on 05.05.2024, and the probation period ends on 06.05.2025.
In this case, May 2025 should be included in the accrual calculation, since the confirmation occurs within the same month.

Current issue:

  • The current business rule excludes the probation confirmation month and begins accrual from the following month (e.g. from June in the above example).

  • After testing and some adjustments, we found that the rule only works correctly if the Job Information record starts on the 1st of the month or before the confirmation date.

    • In that case, the confirmation month is correctly included in the accrual calculation.

Question:

Is there any way to include the probation confirmation month in the accrual logic even if the confirmation date is not on the 1st of the month? Can this be achieved by configuring the business rule differently or by using a workaround?

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you and best reagrds

Thiphawan

entry.title: Re: SAC Story Filters: Profit Center & Product ‚Äì Dependen...
entry.content:
@vinay_009 

Data Access control only work on Fact data and not Master Data. So even with DAC, you would see all profit center in Story filter. They might not show up on table as fact data in table will be restricted to PC where the user has access to. With cascading option enabled on the story filter for products, it can restrict products filter with only those PC combination which has data which is anyway controlled by DAC for PC. After QRC3 upgrade the table in un booked state can be set to show only member combination respecting the DAC so it will show only valid PC but for products valid combination either set up validation rules or DAC.

 

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/b46f2f74aea04c399ccb5c9b1bcc225e.html#securing-data-at-the-dimension-level

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: How to delete Local ($TMP) objects from PRD.
entry.content: Hi , please note that according to our Rules of Engagement: "If you want to publish content that was helped/created by GenAI, you must add the user tag  GenAI Assisted Content. For content where it's not possible to add a user tag (e.g., answers), you must include this statement: "GenAI was used to help generate this content." We have edited your answer and added the GenAI-statement as we detected AI-generated content in your post. Thank you for your contribution in the SAP Community! Best regards, Kavya

In short I'm using Workzone as an intranet and workspaces as my subsections. This is necessary because of the limited number of navigation levels available (essentially three levels is the deepest you can go with the stock navigation). 

So I want search to search all my workspaces from anywhere in the whole tenant - I'll never be able to teach my users to reset the scope control to "All" from "This Workspace" every time.

entry.title: Re: Standard and Custom condition types - PO pricing cond...
entry.content:
Hello @KARTHIK-G ,

Thank you for your question,

In the PO UI, there is no clear visual indicator to differentiate a SAP-standard condition type from a copied one unless you used Y/Z.

This might be the correct fix is configuration.

Prefer Y/Z IDs for custom types (SAP) guidance. SAP Learning/Configuring Condition Types for Pricing Elements

In Set Pricing Condition Types-Purchasing , retain only the customised type you wish to use access sequence control, SAP Help Portal-Determining Tax Code in Purchase Documents using Pricing Conditions

In Set Calculation Schema - Purchasing, include that custom type in the schema and remove or exclude the standard one or set it to non-manual, so users cannot add it in the PO SAP Support Portal-3043325 - SSCUI - 101095 Set Calculation Schema - Purchasing and Statistical Flag Behaviour

SAP standard condition types have restrictions; if you need different behaviour, copy to a customer type (Y/Z). SAP explicitly advises this and even blocks certain changes on standard types  SAP Support Portal-2880754 - Cannot change Group Condition for condition type

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: The Pragmatist‚Äôs Guide to AI: From Architectural Foundation to Real-World Value
entry.content:
Picture this: a demand forecast model trained on years of sales data looks perfect in testing, but once live, it misses a major promotion and a supply chain disruption because that data sits elsewhere. The model wasn‚Äôt wrong ‚Äî it was perfectly wrong.

At SAP TechEd 2025, a joint session with Google Cloud will show how to close the Context Gap and unlock real business impact with AI. The session will explore:

  • The provocation ‚Äì Casey West, Lead Developer Advocate at Google Cloud, reframes the AI challenge, introducing the Context Gap.
  • The proof in action ‚Äì Laura Marwood, SAP Product Strategist for the SAP Business Suite will show a live demo on how SAP‚Äôs unified suite lets AI orchestrate seamlessly across roles and systems that turns chaos into growth
  • The architectural blueprint ‚Äì Manoj Swaminathan, GM and CPO of the SAP Business Suite, Finance and Spend explains the foundation: a clean core, unified data fabric on BTP, and embedded AI by design.
  • The playbook ‚Äì A practical maturity model guides teams from efficiency > productivity > true impact.

This is AI for pragmatists: closing the Context Gap with SAP‚Äôs suite-first strategy so AI doesn‚Äôt just generate output - it creates lasting business value.

üëâ Don‚Äôt miss this session at SAP TechEd 2025!

https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin/flow/sap/te25/catalog-inperson/page/catalog/session/1749125306565001Gf8a

entry.title: Physical IP missing for Load balancer (ASCS Host) on VPC servers
entry.content:
We install ASCS on application Load Balancer (ALB) which does not have physical IP assigned in VPC scenario. And due to limitation in clustering limitation, we can not assign physical IP to ALBs.

 

While doing SSI in FRUN for ASCS, ALB IP information is missing, which results SSI red and does not monitor ASCS. 

 

As workaround we use to add dummy IP in /etc/host file of ALB, which fix issue for monitoring but application does not restart and communication with application server fails. Finally system goes down. which is major impact on business. 

We need help from you to provide another way to get IP address not from /etc/ host file. Any parameter or any changes in FRUN LMDB host details or Agent parameter, which should not overwrite next LMDB sync. 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Physical IP missing for Load balancer (ASCS Host) on...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

SAP Focused Run monitoring relies on hostname resolution to valid IP addresses. This requirement does not align with an application Load Balancer based VPC setup, where no static IP is provided.

  • The /etc/hosts workaround can resolve the hostname for monitoring, but it will break real connectivity and cause ASCS/application failures.

  • There is no supported parameter in Focused Run LMDB or agent that allows a static IP override that persists after synchronization.

Therefore, this scenario is outside the support scope of SAP Focused Run.

We recommend that you engage your Virtual Private Cloud / Cloud Network support team to:

  1. Configure a DNS alias (e.g., via Route53, Azure DNS, or similar) that points to the application Load Balancer DNS name.

  2. Ensure this alias is maintained as the ASCS virtual hostname in LMDB.

  3. Explore Virtual Private Cloud-level options such as NAT, elastic IPs, or endpoint IP mappings if your cloud provider allows it.

These steps need to be handled at the cloud network layer, not within Focused Run.
